wiki.content:
Cocaine is track and a cover song from Eric Clapton's 1977 album called Slowhand, his best-selling record of the Seventies.The original version was played by J.J. Cale, and it is considered holding an anti-drug message.
 
 The guitar solo featured in this song is widely considered as some of Clapton's best work.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: Cocaine is track and a cover song from Eric Clapton's 1977 album called Slowhand, his best-selling record of the Seventies.The original version was played by J.J. Cale, and it is considered holding an anti-drug message.  The guitar solo featured in this song is widely considered as some of Clapton's best work.

track.name: Cocaine
comments: not a good version but anyway fab. song.
Klasse!!!!
Sniff...
RIP JJ Cale
Crom has delivered on my prayer! Lastfm is playing the original Clapton version! Hails!
Is this JJ Cale singing?
Play real Clapton for gosh sakes!!
I always listen to it from my originally CD - no problems folks. ;-)
For Crom's sake, PLAY THE ORIGINAL!
This isn't Eric Clapton :-(((
Imposter!
I don't believe this is Clapton. I dunno, maybe he had nasal congestion when it was recorded. Ugh!  Do not like it.

Herrlich !
 Den Song meine ich...
I don't think that it's Clapton either.
Can I ask what this is? Does not sound Clapton.....
Classic
cocaine , omammamiaaaaaaaaa

The original studio version Clapton did is the best version. I get really fed up with the live version these days when he adds in "That dirty cocaine". Do we really need to hear that, EC? If the idiots out there do not understand it is an anti-drug song, f**k 'em.
awsome :-)
great track to jam along with your guitar, love it
